website_summaries.verdict: Despite some quirks, this inexpensive MP3 player comes with notable capabilities for a low price. A good choice for beginners and budget-minded music lovers.
pros: It has an impressive feature set that includes picture browsing, FM radio access, and easy-to-use controls
Storage space can be expanded to 128GB with an SD card
Comes with ample accessories including earphones, USB cable, and arm band
cons: Some Bluetooth connectivity issues and durability concerns noted
User manual is confusing and not very helpful

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: For the price point this is a good mp3 player. It seems to be well made, the battery is long lasting and it will hold around 1500 songs (plus you can add an sd card for more). Also, the speaker is surprisingly clear. The only down side for me was that the charger included was just a usb cable and I prefer to charge with an outlet. However, I can use my cell charger for the mp3 player so it isn't a huge deal.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M.

customer_reviews.title: affordable, portable and works!
customer_reviews.text: This little device held my entire music library with no problem. It functions like I expected it to and has a really good battery life. I was actually really impressed with the speakers on the mp3 player. I did not expect it to sound so good! I'm really happy that it came with an armband that fit the mp3 player perfectly. You can tell that it was custom made for this little device. I use it on my treadmill with no issues. It was a breeze to navigate my library through the armband. I highly recommend this mp3 player especially for this price!
customer_reviews.author: Borg Queen

customer_reviews.title: Nice cheap phone music alternative
customer_reviews.text: I got this mp3 player to use in my car instead of my phone. I'm on a limited data plan and streaming all the time consumes most of my Gbs. This player has Bluetooth connectivity which helps me pair it with my car's FM transmitter and it just works. The screen is pretty meh, has bad viewing angles, but I don't use it to watch videos or photos. It also has a book reader (txt) which is nice if you need that on the go. Overall a great deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mikeleus

customer_reviews.title: Poor Volume and crappy bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to really like this unit. Design is good easy to set up. However on the second day the bluetooth started acting up. 1st day it interfaced with my Trex great. 2 nd day as long as I was sitting still all was great but when I went out to walk my dog bluetooth kept dropping. Had on my arm same as 1st day. Unit was only 18" from my headphones. Second problem was volume. Had unit plugged directly into my electronic noise muffs and at full volume was barely able to hear over my lawnmower. Company has unit locked at 31? %? Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Cheap trash
customer_reviews.text: Absolute trash. Which you can tell right away because they offer you a $20 amazon card in the box if you give them a 5 star review, so be careful most of these reviews may be dubious. Pros: Storage is decent. You can assign files to folders. Cons: Battery life is horrible. Left it fully charged and next day it was dead. User interface seems like its from the early 2000's. Hard to navigate and confusing. Goodluck getting bluetooth to initially connect to your device properly. When changing volume you have to wait for about 10 seconds before you can do anything else on screen. Pretty heavy .
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Good while it worked.
customer_reviews.text: Internal screen components broke within a week and a half of use, despite the surface glass and the rest of the device being spotless. If it was sufficiently durable, it would be a fine little product.
customer_reviews.author: VSchulke

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the high price.
customer_reviews.text: I came from a Sansa Clip+, probably the world's best MP3 player. Unfortunately, they've become very expensive and I wanted to try something new with a screen. I tried this. I wish I hadn't. The audio jack is extremely touchy and causes charp distortion crackles at random. The speaker is pathetic. The earbuds didn't work at all. The equilizer just lowers the volume of your device, rather than boosting specific ranges. It doesn't feel smooth to use at all and it takes several presses to make the buttons do things. Then there's the price... Yikes. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: PoniesPlayingPoker

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use and the sound quality is amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is a superb little gadget for listening to music. I got this as a replacement for my ipod that I lost and it has nothing to envy it. Superb sound quality and battery life. I love the fact that you can lock the screen so that you can put it in your pocket and an accidental touch won't interfere with the music. It also has a simple way of cataloging songs by album, artist or genre. Didn't need to read the instructions at all, this is very straightforward and even a kid would know how to use it. If you want a high quality mp3 player for a very reasonable price, this is what you should get.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Kinda Figity but with good sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Drag and drop feature is easy enough to use but there is no built in setup. You have to manually add folders. Lot of work to set up. Interface is not the most intuitive compared to other devices. So far I haven't been able to get it to work with my Kia car bluetooth. Ear buds it came with were terrible - not comfortable and hurt sound quality. I switched to an older pair of earbuds and it improved the sound quality. Cant use it with iTunes. Look, size and feel didnt bother me.
customer_reviews.author: Babs101

customer_reviews.title: Surprising sound!
customer_reviews.text: I chose this to replace an old Fuze. There was a bit of a learning curve, and I could have used more precise user info, but once it was working, the sound was really good --AFTER INSERTING A BETTER SET OF EARBUDS! (The ones that come with the device are about equal to the ones you get on a plane!) I haven't tried all the features yet,--like plugging it into my car-- but the quality of the music alone made this purchase well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Granny B

customer_reviews.title: Excellant sound and battery life
customer_reviews.text: I use an MP3 product primarily to listen to audio books. This product provides good sound but requires a complicated system of filing books in a way that puts them all in a single file without being able to call each book individually. There are many additional functions. A pedometer, and stopwatch for example. In spite of the instruction book which came with the unit, I have been unable to understand how to operate the pedometer and, the stopwatch operation is too awkward to be used efficiently. Battery life and recharge time is excellent. Can not comment on Bluetooth as yet.
customer_reviews.author: John Barry

customer_reviews.title: Lots of strange things
customer_reviews.text: I shut it off every time I am done. Sometimes when I hit power, it won't come on no matter what I do. Until I found a trick, hold the volume up and the power for 10 seconds, and then it will power on. (old trick for rebooting dead android phones). Other issue, is when copy huge amounts of data to internal memory, it drops it's connection if I use a USB 3 port. If I use a USB 2 port it works fine. I wish it would remember where I was when I shut it down also. Will probably replace with something else, but will ask a few more questions next time.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Farrell

customer_reviews.title: Very good and safe.
customer_reviews.text: very good product, with excellent materials and does not have the appearance or weight of something cheap or of poor quality. the daily buttons are touch sensitive and only the side buttons are physical. there are 16 Gb of memory with the possibility of expansion with a memory card, I put about 500 songs and still had a lot of space available. the initiation was very fast and the response to the commands is also very effective, the headset is very good and loud! I am very satisfied with the product and I think it is great for racing or giving to children as it is safer.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Does a lot for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little mp3 player for the price. With a micro SD card your storage space is nearly unlimited and the sound quality is really good. The interface takes a little getting used to, but once you figure it out, it isnt too bad. I feel the controls would be better if there were little feedback, they are touch sensitive and I wish they depressed a little so you know you pressed it. Other than that, the website for registration is not very user friendly. Other than 2 small issues, I am pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: OCK913

customer_reviews.title: gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I got this MP3 once yet another iPod broke down beyond repair, wanting to keep listening to podcasts and music during workouts and on the go and NOT wanting to spend a fortune. While the interface is definitely much simpler-looking and clunkier than on an iPod, it's easy enough to navigate and does the job. It's easy to download any mp3 audios, and it does group them into albums. I haven't been able to forward or rewind a given track once you start listening to it, but other than that, I don't have any complaints about the device. The batter life is good. It comes with a handy arm band, too.
customer_reviews.author: The fat cat

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly - no search feature
customer_reviews.text: Apparently there's no way to easily find and play an given song, album, or artist without slowly tabbing through the entire directory. Perhaps this device could be improved (to where it's at all useful) by having a PC app that would allow user to build customized playlists and load them. Anyway, I'm eating the $40 and chalking it up to experience. See video review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High hopes for it, but just doesn’t compare to the iPod.
customer_reviews.text: I’m in my 30s and consider myself not bad with technology, this mps player drove me nuts from the time I got it. I was very excited about all the amount of songs I could put on it and the option of the scan disk which I did. I finally figured out how to make places and transfer songs which I come from an iPod (which broke). But the ease of everyday use with this compared to an iPod is night and day. After a solid 3 months trying 2 give it a Valiant effort, I could no longer, I broke down and bought another used iPod.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Not a shuffle for all modes
customer_reviews.text: Will only shuffle for the "main" song list. Under the play all selection. This is for both file listings, the internal memory and the external card. Handbook also states it will only shuffle up to 4001 songs. If you choose an artist, lets say there are 200 songs. IT WILL NOT SHUFFLE. If you choose a playlist, various artists, various genres, IT WILL NOT SHUFFLE. This lack of a common feature for ALL files is extremely disappointing. The touch screen is a little difficult to use.
customer_reviews.author: NJ

customer_reviews.title: NOT intuitive. The internets are awash in people asking how the heck to unlock it
customer_reviews.text: The sound is good. It's lightweight. It's a devil to figure out and the most irritating thing of all is the accidental locking and difficulty unlocking. If you Google 'unlock soulcker' you will see many people, many frustrated people, trying to figure this out. There is much tearing of hair, much cursing the gods, not to mention soulcker. I do not think it it is an accident that the name of the device is not mentioned on the product page. It just says 'MP3 Player, 16GB MP3 Player with Bluetooth 4.0, Portable HiFi Lossless Sound MP3 Music Player with FM Radio Voice Recorder E-Book 2.4'' Screen, Support up to 128GB (Headphone, Sport Armband Included)'.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Help .... no way to automatically enable blue tooth at startup.
customer_reviews.text: Does anyone know how to set up this MP3 player so that it will automatically enable blue tooth when turned on? I always use blue tooth ear phones, so always want blue tooth on. When this player is turned off, blue tooth must be manually enabled the next time it is turned on. Have I missed something ??? Edit : 05/20/19 Initial rating of 2 stars was a bit harsh. With the exception of automatic bluetooth at power on, all other functions are as expected. Sound quality is superb. Bumping rating to 4 stars, removing one star due to bluetooth issue.
customer_reviews.author: K. W. Cash

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe there are all these rave reviews. The controls are horrid, the interface is so dated it looks like it is more than a decade old, the sound is terrible and tinny, and you can toss the headphones-- they are worse than the throw away ones provided by airlines. And unfortunately, the speakers are so bad you really do need headphones to listen to the music. The player was barely OK initially but once I downloaded music, it started to get really slow and the controls kept freezing. You really get what you pay for. I returned it and got myself a decent $200 MP3 that is simply awesome. Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to navigate
customer_reviews.text: Not the easiest unit I've had the pleasure of working with, but this unit does work once you're able to figure it out. The instructions included with this unit are simple and written by a fourth grade student somewhere, (whom I suspect, is failing in their English studies). I got much more reliable information on this unit from online instructions than I did from the included instructions. This unit will not work with iTunes! But it will work with Quick Time. (Quick Time was included with the macs I've had.) I opened the songs I wanted in Quick Time then 'moved' them to this unit. It works once you figure it out...
customer_reviews.author: G. D. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is awesome and the bluetooth feature works great. I use it mainly to listen to audio books and it does not restart where I left off after turning it off, even when I set a bookmark. It sometimes even starts on a different book. I really wanted to like this MP3 player and was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: princessdjwm

customer_reviews.title: Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: This MP3 Player is a nice size, and wieght. I bought this mainly for music , MP3s and and digital media files. Well so far I am very happy. The bluetooth signal is good for about 20 ft. This will main depend on the device your using to play bluetooth to also. But, no hiss at high volume levels, equalizer works well to boost as 5 bands. Battery seems real good, the earphones that come with the unit aren't terrible, not much bass but good clarity. Comes with an Velcro armband holder, and USB to usb micro. I haven't tried it in the car yet, but if there's an issue I will followup. Otherwise I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Lorne Waters

customer_reviews.title: Excellent 16GB MP3 Player, Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I was most impressed with this device, only ever having used Apple ipods in the past. The little handbook said it is not compatible with iTunes, but would appear as an external drive when connected (by the included cable) to my macbook pro, where I'd dragged all my mp3 music files into a folder on the desktop. The 300 songs only used 1GB of the 16GB, and copied swiftly onto the MP3 Player, where they showed clearly and easy to see in the music section. The control arrows are a decent size on this sturdy device and respond to touch rather than being pressed. I love it, and highly recommend it. The sound quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Marcy

customer_reviews.title: Headphone jack defective
customer_reviews.text: This MP3 player was at the outset a very good player with good strong bluetooth signal, but in a matter of weeks the headphone jack became defective, causing a lot of crackling and cutting in and out. Since I mostly use it with wired headphones, this is very disappointing. Too bad - it is such a good player in every other respect, but not using quality materials for the headphone jack is unforgivable. This is the downfall of many a good product, and so unnecessary. I don't really want to just return it - I would like to get a replacement if possible. Maybe the first one was just defective and a second one would last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Dale E. Landry

customer_reviews.title: the device doesnt have basic features
customer_reviews.text: after contacting the support I realized there is not an option to transfer multiple songs to a playlist, so I had to transfer them one by one. also, its not possible to change a playlist name. you can do all of these by downloading an app though, but why do I need to start downloading apps just to be able to do basic things?? also, when you use the Armband with no headphones, its not possible to hear anything since the speaker is "blocked" by your arm. as an Hebrew speaker, the device offers Hebrew but written from left to write (instead of right to left), in other words - its not readable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would Buy Again
customer_reviews.text: This is the first MP3 I've had since 2007 and its a lot better then I remember them being. Especially the battery on this thing! I work ten hour shifts every weekday and I have to charge it twice a week. I use it all day too. However not using headphones will cause that battery to drain in 2 hours. It is not touch screen but its easy navigate. Comes with earbuds and a little arm band to slide the device in which I thought was very nice. Stores a good bit of music and ebooks. Still trying to get some audible on there but so far no luck. Overall, would buy again if this one ever breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Balboa

customer_reviews.title: Holds lots of music and battery lasts
customer_reviews.text: Update: 4/14/20- after having it a few months my daughter was having tissues with buttons not working! And then one day it stopped working! So even with a full battery it still won’t turn on or work at all! Not worth the buy! My daughter uses this daily and we haven’t charged it in weeks! Perfect and holds a lot of music. From iTunes files and from old MP3 player files from the 90’s my her dad and I’s players. She’s really enjoying the music. We haven’t found the perfect headphones yet. We tried a cheap Bluetooth pair that didn’t play all the songs for some reason. But regular plug headphones plays them all just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 6 and 8 year old - and would be great for me too! But seller shady about rebate.
customer_reviews.text: This MP3 player is very reasonably priced and competes well with common-name-brand iPod versions. It works great, is sturdy/durable, and works awesome for my kid's little hands (would be great for adult as well). It is easy to use, easy to load MP3s (no weird formatting issues like sometimes with iPods) - accepts music from any MP3 source. 5 stars! Update: The device came with a $20 rebate card with proof of writing an honest review and the order #. I followed the instructions and they got shady about the rebate (have not received it)...so I would not repurchase from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: happimomma

customer_reviews.title: Simple and quality player
customer_reviews.text: I am using this player primarily for my car (old music system with no BT) using Aux and I’m happy the way it works. The file transfer is simple, connected on a windows computer and transferred my favorites folder and copy took around 6 minutes. All the files are in mp3 or 4 format and the player plays it without a hitch. Currently connected to Honda Fit, the steering control works with the player. The screen is bright for its size and primarily getting used to play music on car so no thoughts about video playback though. Build quality is good and the player feels heavy for its size cos of the build. Comes with pouch, earbuds and charging cable
customer_reviews.author: Guru

customer_reviews.title: Soulcker MP3
customer_reviews.text: Experienced some cutting-out during audiobook playback but nothing to ruin the story. Bookmarking is a pain in the ass as are other like functions but they worked as intended. UPDATE: After owning this device for a couple weeks, I'm changing my review. It looses the memory of my two earbud devices and needs re-pairing; it freezes and has to be rebooted; the USB cable sent with it did not work.
customer_reviews.author: ViperEye

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mp3 for on the move!
customer_reviews.text: After having used this for a bit I can safely say that it is a fantastic mp3 player! I needed something other than my phone for riding my bike and listening to music on the trails and this device fits the job perfectly, and without leaving much of a dent in the old wallet. Music sounds better than on my phone, love the built in radio with easy presets, has video playing functions, and even supports a wide range of audio files. I have to admit, I use to have an old Sansa mp3 player years ago and this device does everything and more, so yeah, I'm enamored with it for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Wraith

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and perfect for my everyday music needs...
customer_reviews.text: My iPod died, and as much as I liked it I really didn't like it enough to spend $$$ on another one. The Soulcker was a perfect match to use at my night job, around the home, the beach and walking Fido...I use it everyday. I love the touch screen and it's real easy to transfers song from PC. You can disable the screen saver so I can see the lists when I want with out activating the screen every time I want to change a song. Oh, BTW the audio quality is excellent... It feels better built then my iPod and well made for outdoors. This was a good purchase and I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch MP3 Player, Don't Pass on This
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my phone to play my music for years, I read some of the reviews about this Very Well Made MP3 Player- it is better than anyone could describe, I can go to the far ends of the ranch and have my favorites easy to keep using, no matter what I'm doing, I can play all my stress relieving tunes, the battery life is remarkable ( it came fully charged and after 20+ hours of playing, it still has lots of power, the included accessories are an added bonus. If anyone is looking for a Very High Quality MP3 Player, Look no further, Thanks Amazon for such a High Quality Product at a Very Good Price
customer_reviews.author: Daniel SmithTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Best Customer Service Ever!
customer_reviews.text: This MP3 player is very attractive with an easy-to-see screen, easy to use controls and it has a blue light when the controls are touched. I use it to connect to the input AUX on a Bose Wave Radio so I can play my favorite music through the radio. The quality of the music stored on the SD card comes through very clear and sounds great coming from the Bose. The controls on the front screen resemble the previous iPod Classic which everyone is familiar with. I had a problem with the player, but the Soulcker Group cheerfully refunded my cost so I could re-purchase it.
customer_reviews.author: GA BUBBA

customer_reviews.title: pretty nice alternative to an ipod
customer_reviews.text: It does a lot for very little money. I just wanted a cheap music player that I could shuffle tunes from, and for that it's great. Bluetooth works well, and the FM radio works surprisingly well, though you need to use your headphone cables as an antenna. The only thing I really dislike is the lock "feature". I didn't realize that it had locked; it eventually meant looking it up online to find out how to unlock it (hold the menu button down). It's well worth the money, especially if you have a ton of MP3 music. Add a memory card and you're covered forever.
customer_reviews.author: D S

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculous Amount of Features
customer_reviews.text: I don't even know where to start with this MP3 Player. First, it comes with every accessory you need. Normally you would need to purchase all of these separately. But not with this. .You get a screen protector, arm band holder, headphones. The whole 9 yards. I love that it already has quite a bit of memory but you also have the option of adding even more space with an SD card. The bluetooth let me connect to my wireless speaker, my car, my treadmill and my wireless headphones. The sound quality is excellent as well. So many options on this mp3 player. It is well worth the price. And even that is low!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect MP3 player!
customer_reviews.text: The big reason for buying this is for my fitness activities. I use my personal phone for music during my cardio workouts. Biggest thing that trouble me was the phone calls/messages that were distracting me during the workouts. I wanted to keep a music player just for the workouts and stay away from phone. While searching for music player on amazon I found the amazon choice one “Soulcker”. So far I am liking this. Good battery and pretty good in built audio. I am using this with my TWE. So haven’t really used the wired earphones. Decent size. Light weight. Now am happy that my workouts are not bothered by phone calls/messages
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! Impressive! High quality!
customer_reviews.text: I was blown away with the quality of this player! It's enclosed in metal with great video quality, good ear buds, holds a ton of music, awesome photo quality... This mp3 even has a calendar, alarm, pedometer, a built in speaker and more. It comes with charger, ear buds, armband, and screen protector. I can't say enough good about this product. I especially love the multiple tiers of folders I can create to store all my audio. NOTE: If you get a card with the player saying you'll get a FULL REFUND from Amazon as part of Refund Event, don't believe it.
customer_reviews.author: S.S.Rudick

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: For $40 you get everything you need in a compact MP3 player. It plays MP3s, has a screen lock, remembers where you are in podcasts and audiobooks when you turn off/on, is easy to load things on to (through file explorer or finder), has decent organization format, etc... Seems solid and as long as it holds up over the coming months will be well worth it and a good alternative to replacing my dying iPod Nano (which are still $175 to buy, yeesh). The screen is a bit dim in bright sun and the unit it relatively heavy for what it is, but come on... $40 for a full featured MP3 player is pretty dang good.
customer_reviews.author: Brady B

customer_reviews.title: Impressive MP3 Player
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I am impressed for the money! After over paying for Apple products I wanted to try something else. This MP3 player works well and is packed with features. It was easy to put music on and synced up great with my bluetooth speaker. If you use iTunes you can convert the M4A music files to MP3 using iTunes (right click > Create MP3 Version) to play on this device. Just grab the files from your Music > iTunes folder; drag and drop them in the music folder on the device and that is it. Give it a try, there is no sense in paying more for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT DEVICE AND PRICE!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device at a great price. All I wanted was a device to play music while I ride my bicycle. I was looking at iPods and they are very pricey. I decided to give this a try based on the reviews and the price. I LOVE IT! The sound is really good, it fits in my pocket and i'm actually surprised at how many features it has. It was very easy for me to transfer music to it just by plugging it into my computer and dragging all of my itunes songs into a folder. I'm very happy with this purchase! It's exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: jalapenohelen

customer_reviews.title: Good for wired use, bad for bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: This is a good mp3, but my biggest issue is the bluetooth. Its a bit fuzzy or gives feedback. I only have this issue with this device and my headphones work fine with other bluetooth devices. I mostly wanted to bluetooth features, but it works great with wired headphones. If that is all you really need, then this is a good mp3.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Bulky, Trendy, cutting edge latest gadget look... Just Love it....!!!!
customer_reviews.text: 1. product was different from what I thought... it was actually heavy and bulky as I first grab the unit... I felt the weightiness of the product which brought feeling of good quality product. 2. Better than I thought the sound quality, with what I have paid i didn't expected this quality, but there was clear separation of High tweeter sound and low base tube sound all together, love the way it communicate with the song. 3. Bluetooth is big plus, 4. wow..... // /it even has its own speaker mounted on the unit...!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris the accurate..

customer_reviews.title: How is this rated so high?
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes with the reviews which were so good. But the device doesn't let you easily listen from an sd card. If you have all your music on a card, each time you listen, you'd have to tell the device to look on the card, not the device. The interface is cumbersome and whoever designed it as clearly not a native English speaker. All around clunky and cumbersome. I returned it and will spend more on a player that I know will have better quality.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy
customer_reviews.text: Several problems. Touch-sensitive buttons are WAY too sensitive. When it reaches the end of a long playlist instead of starting over, starts another one. Will not stay connected to the computer to download music files. Controls are confusing. Instruction book is useless. All around poor choice, at least for me. I'm going to be looking for another, better one. Quality of sound is not bad, though.
customer_reviews.author: Goose

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 7 years old who loves music. It is very sleek looking, not too small, sturdy although a bit heavier than I expected, only reason I dont like heavier is because if he drops it it can break, although it feels sturdy. It almost feels like an iPhone in your hands as it's sleek and rounded. I only tried the music so far and quality seems good, it has a built in speaker so you can listen to music without headphones, not too loud though. It has bluetooth which is sheer reading I bought this player instead of others. So far I am happy, I will update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: SNY531

customer_reviews.title: Lock feature doesn't work but the player holds LOTS of music
customer_reviews.text: Check out the photo to see how I solved the problem with the LOCK feature not working. Other than this issue, I really like the player. It can store my entire music library with the addition of the card. I can't believe the sound quality and the amount of songs it holds. I'm an avid hiker. I hike everywhere and spend hours listening to music. This is the best player I've ever had. Long battery. As for the LOCK feature, it is part of the touch screen DOH!!! which means if ANYTHING touches the screen (lint, gum wrapper, headphone cord, etc... then it will NOT LOCK).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids!
customer_reviews.text: My boys were begging me for cell phones so that they could have music...they are not old enough for phone so my husband and I decided to look for MP3 players for them. Our oldest earned his money for one and loved it and when the other son earned his money, we ordered another one. They had no problems figuring it out and learning how to use it. I connect it to WMP to transfer music and then they are able to create their own playlists. They like the pedometer feature as well. All in all, we are happy with the quality and the ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Shela

customer_reviews.title: Better than any Apple product any day!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice music player! As an IT professional for the past 15 years I am NOT a Apple fan. It's not that Apple has crappy products, I do not like the business practices of Apple. You pay more of anything Apple plus Apple has such tight controls of their products. Also, everything Apple is proprietary, no competing hardware or software permitted. Products like this music player is the way to go! You have much more freedom to download and backup your music as YOU see fit. I love the features of this player also!
customer_reviews.author: Skot

customer_reviews.title: Best all-around value for any MP3 player.
customer_reviews.text: Doing some research on the best MP3 player for the value, I discovered the SOULCKER. The initial attraction was the integral 16GB memory which is more than sufficient to hold the majority of songs I have. I enjoy the sleek size, and the long battery life, and ease of uploading files to the player from my computer, Controls are a little bit hard to navigate though. The arm band is thin and a welcome inclusion for those of us who are active. Audio is clear and enjoyable. For the price it cannot be beat.
customer_reviews.author: L. Deffner

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this MP3 player
customer_reviews.text: My 20 year old Walkman finally gave up and I was looking for a reasonably priced player. I was pleasantly surprised with all the features this player has. I received it charged and ready to use. Transferring music from my computer was fast and easy using Windows Media Player, just drag and drop and hit sync. The sound quality is very good. The controls are easy to use and the screen is large. I paired it with my Bluetooth speakers and the sound is great. I will be investing in some Bluetooth ear buds for my morning walks. So far I am really pleased and would definitely recommend this player.
customer_reviews.author: lal

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good, inexpensive mp3 player. I bought it for my son, who is 17, for his birthday last summer and it worked great. He walks a few miles everyday, and always has his device on his ears! When we DID have a problem (the screen froze and we couldn't power it down), we contacted Jon at Support@soulcker.com and he was very quick to respond and offered to replace the device. But then, as soon as he discovered he could not, he completely refunded us, no questions asked. We will definitely be ordering another one. We already have 2 others for household members. Great little device, and GREAT customer service. Thanks, Jon!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent low cost, high volume music player
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good purchase if you are looking for a portable media player that can play many formats of audio, video and text, operate as a voice recorder. With a micro SD card, this becomes a high volume media device in a small form factor. The software is well designed and logical to navigate and the controls of the unit work wall and are robust for long term usage and travel. Overall this is highly recommended, and can be considered to be a to be a very solid alternative to high cost brands like Fiio.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Niland

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS MUSIC PLAYER!! IT DESTROYED MY MACBOOK.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS. I PLUGGED THIS IN TO MY LAPTOP TO TRANSFER MUSIC AND MY MACBOOK SHOWED THE SPINNING BEACH BALL. After 10 minutes, I restarted my Macbook and it has the question mark on a folder icon. A Macbook specialist says it has an ssd problem and either needs repair or replacement. There were zero signs that my Macbook had issues prior to plugging in this made-in-China device. Don’t save money by getting this product, look elsewhere. DO NOT BUY THIS DEFECTIVE PRODUCT. No one knows if the product you receive will be that odd one out that KILLS YOUR MACBOOK. DON’T TAKE THE RISK.
customer_reviews.author: Brian s Drayton

customer_reviews.title: Software Sucks - NOT FOR RUNNING
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Battery life is good Cons: The software sucks (really sucks, you have to back out of certain screens to use the side buttons, many other annoying flaws), its a touchscreen and will not respond when wet (I run with my MP3 player in my pocket), does not support transferring playlists. This is a good bluetooth mp3 player if you plan to load with music, connect it, press play, and not touch it.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk J. Guotana

customer_reviews.title: Price / Quality / Features are terrific - solid replacement for an Apple Nano
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product for the price. As Apple discontinued the iPod, and my Apple device had failed I needed a replacement. I had no prior experience with the MP3 format. Going online to Google gave me the steps necessary to transfer my music library to the MP3 format, and transferring it to this device was a simple drag. Sound quality is good, and the “shuffle” option is identical to the Apple one. Only downside - playlists don’t transfer and setting up new ones are a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Michael N. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: So far I have about 100 songs on my player. Enjoy listening to 80's and 90's music so this was a perfect choice. I use this player when walking my dogs, mowing the lawn, gardening and the sound and battery life has been superb. The arm band comes in very handy. The device is sturdy not cheap plastic. You do need the earbuds plugged in to use the FM radio to act as an antenna. Was easy to figure out how to use. I would definitely recommend buying one if you're looking for a digital music player.
customer_reviews.author: pam zygmunt

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great MP3 Player! I love the long battery life, large internal storage capacity and the easy locking feature. The sound quality was also better than other players I’ve used. Another nice feature is the ability to adjust the volume without unlocking. It was a little larger than expected, but that has not been a problem. I’ve only used this to play music so I cannot comment on the other features, but it was very easy to load my music. I’m very happy with the player and definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tim O

customer_reviews.title: Getting harder to find these
customer_reviews.text: Nice MP3 player. I don't want to use my phone for music to run the battery down. Also, there are storage issues. This player, with 16gb of storage, has plenty of room. I'll learn the interface soon. I'm so used to touchscreens that I keep trying to tap on the album or track I want to play, forgetting that I have to use the pointers at the bottom and press the center of the circle. Haven't used the FM radio yet, but that will come in handy at a race track to listen to the local broadcast of the event. The recorder is also handy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Graham

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price point
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it as this is not worth the price point. Interface is very old, I mean nokia 6600 old which came out in 2003. Sound quality was okay but not as good as other competitors. I could not connect it to my PC . Tried it with multiple PCs and USB ports but no avail. May be the piece that I received was faulty so contacted their customer care and it was really bad . This was the main reason to return the product. I literally got 1 text message from their customer service after a week acknowledging that they have received my request for technical problem. They should work on customer service and improve the UI/Interface
customer_reviews.author: El Hombre

customer_reviews.title: Very good mp3 player for the price
customer_reviews.text: Been working so far really well. I needed an mp3 to listen to in the car. It came in a nice box with headphones and an arm strap case. The sound quality is really good once you pair it with some nice headphones. The menu is easy to navigate. I wish there was a way to update the firmware because I would like to put rockbox on it. I like the feeling of the metal back. It also gives it a nice weight to it. I also like that it has a built in speaker so you can know what song it's on when there is nothing plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Piper

customer_reviews.title: Best mp3 player on Amazon so far...
customer_reviews.text: I really can't judge the battery at this point. But so far just having this charged up and listened to it with an hour from recieving it, I'm very satisfied. I've wasted my time with the Sony, Agptek, and some other generic brand to find out this brand is the best. Easy and smooth to maneuver around the menu and to create my own playlist. And on top of it the sound is great. I bought this to listen to music so far as the other features I can't say anything about how they work. This was well worth $40, if you want a great mp3 player go with this brand.
customer_reviews.author: ConMan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little old school MP3 player
customer_reviews.text: Needed an MP3 player for survival situations where I wouldn't want my position to be triangulated by cell towers (therefore, cannot have internet connectivity). I now actually use this regularly as my primary music player to save phone battery life. Sound is awesome, bluetooth works perfect, button lights are bright and screen is responsive. And it's under 50 bucks. Also it takes SD cards, 16 GB is a good enough amount of memory to carry those essential-I'd-die-without songs, but you can add a card and put on even more. I love this thing, awesome xmas present.
customer_reviews.author: Devlin Healy

customer_reviews.title: Sleekly Superb, A Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: After buying and returning multiple other mp3 players I finally landed on this gem. It has a solid feel to it and a clean look. 16Gb of memory is plenty for me, I use it to listen to audio books constantly but I also put some music on it to get a better idea of sound quality and it's pretty good. Finally, the Bluetooth capability and ease of use on that score (unlike the ones I returned) make this a perfect player for me. I would recommend this to my friends if they were in the market.
customer_reviews.author: Dharmakat

customer_reviews.title: Not good as a Wearable
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy. Worked fine as long as you are not wearing it. Hard to load music unless you already have your files in MP3 format (I did not I had AAC). I tried using mine as a basic wearable listening device while I was working (mowing). Unfortunately, it would always manage to stop playing the music within 10-12 seconds, the reason was the touch sensitivity was such that it immediately went into pause. I tried it numerous times became frustrated and threw it away and went back to my aging iPod Shuffle.
customer_reviews.author: 04rk88

customer_reviews.title: Subpar sound quality, but there's not many better alternatives
customer_reviews.text: The Good: - Decent price - Feels solidly built - Bluetooth connectivity - Bright screen The Bad: - U.I. is clumsy - Sound quality is pretty blah (even for this price) The Ugly: - Bluetooth doesn't automatically connect after initial pairing, so you have to manually reconnect every time you use the player.
customer_reviews.author: D. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great, basic MP3 player!
customer_reviews.text: Great MP3 player! Holds 16 GB of files. I plug some used computer speakers into it and I get great stereo hi-fi sound in my small study room! I can also use it to listen to FM radio. I can easily (using my personal computer via USB cable) organize audio sermons and talks and music of different genre into various folders and sub-folders just like I do with file explorer on my personal computer. I'm new to using an MP3 (I'm 69 years old!) but it's quite user-friendly for an old geezer like me! ;o)
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this MP3 player. I bought one for my son, and he loves it. His favorite feature, is how easy it is to use and the fact that his Bluetooth headphones pair with it, with no problems. My daughter wanted an MP3 player also, and I instantly knew this one would be best for her also. They both love the arm band that it comes with, so they don’t have to hold it when wanting to listen to their music. I personally love that I can just plug it into my computer and drop song files into the file and it’s loaded onto it. It’s very user friendly, enjoyable to use, and great for kids.
customer_reviews.author: KelsieHickey

customer_reviews.title: nice device but isn't Audible compatible
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised that the device is solid and not plastic. I also like the file structure, the issues with this device are that it is not recognized by Audible so although has an "Audible" folder - won't play. Secondly, playlists can't be imported - 3 playlists only are available and if you have many playlists, the workaround is to create a file and name it whatever playlist name you like and then move music files into each playlist folder. Very time consuming if like me, you have thousands of song files.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good sound quality, very poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like this MP3 player. It's easy to use and the external speaker has good sound quality. What I don't like: 1. it requires a USB cable to charge instead of having the USB connector attached. One more item to keep track of and carry around. 2. The battery life is very, very poor in my opinion. My previous player got an average of 30+ hours per charge. This one is only getting 10 hours. It does charge quickly but I would rather have longer play time even if it meant longer charging time.
customer_reviews.author: Robin James

customer_reviews.title: A great mp3 player
customer_reviews.text: I got mine a week ago and I'm loving it. Battery lasts a lot. I've been using it for a week now and I never had to charge the battery yet. It has amazing audio quality. It has built in speaker so that I can listen to music without headphone. It is easy to copy songs to it and connecting to my PC is easy. I liked the design. It is simple and it has a good quality screen. You can store pictures and videos and also record voice. All these comes with a reasonable price. Overall, it is a good quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Sajith

customer_reviews.title: Best mp3 player out there!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mp3 player for my daughter and it is perfect! The best option for something at a reasonable price (ipods are just so expensive). She can listen to music and stories and audiobooks from the library. The battery works great, it looks good and is just what we wanted and needed. I would note that it is important to buy from the right seller, check their ratings too! All of the great ratings for this player are from a reputable seller but there are some sellers that are not.
customer_reviews.author: Alli

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: This mp3 player is very well-made. It has so much space, it's simple to use, and the battery life is fantastic. The video quality gets 4 stars because I have to rate it--it's not like an iPhone or anything. If you buy this, it's probably not to watch videos anyway. I have one gripe, but it still doesn't take away from the 5-star rating. I REALLY wish it had a belt clip on the back. It comes with an arm band, but I would much rather clip it to my belt/pants.
customer_reviews.author: AWOL

customer_reviews.title: Good player with a 5,000 song limit
customer_reviews.text: I really wish I'd seen the "up to 5,000 songs" statement before I bought it. It works really well and is easy to use. For someone with over 14,000 songs on a 128GB SD card, this mp3 is a little underpowered for me. I'll most likely give it to my son and find an mp3 player with higher capacity. It's a great player for the price and would recommend it for someone with a smaller music library.
customer_reviews.author: Punkprincess1977

customer_reviews.title: My Flac files sound great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this player because I not only wanted to enjoy my flac files but needed a player that would have enough room to store them. Problem solved now with this player. With an expansion slot up to 128 gigs and 16 gig already in the player I was able to enjoy my music on the go. Although I will usually be using a headphone most of the time but for those times I just want to chill and listen with the installed speakers, they sound great as well and have some volume.. I am really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Usagi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Battery LIfe, Micro sd card srorage, blue tooth!
customer_reviews.text: Never heard of soulshocker, I ordered due to amazing reviews on Amazon. Upon reveiving it,I fully charged it like (everyone should do for any new product) I tested the bluetooth and connected easily. I then connected the device to my computer, I added a ton of mp3 files. I then formatted a 128 gb micro sd card. I also added flac files (lossless audio) and many mny audio books. Great value for the money and well made!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Decent but not what I'm used to
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my aging MP3 Sony Walkman. The sound quality and interface work fine. I'm not a huge fan of the way it scrolls, though. It has a better antenna feature for radio, so that's a plus. I HATE the playlist feature - it's limited and frustrating. I don't know why they decided playlists should be a difficult feature to manage: changing the name isn't intuitive, you can only have 3, and you can't rearrange the songs anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cruff

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I found this! It is the best MP3 player I have found! I converted my MP4 RealPlayer files to MP3 and uploaded them. The player has them in alphabetical order. I didn't use the ear buds that came with it. I have my own. It sounds great with them! Screen is easy to navigate as well.This is not a cheap plastic player either. It is solid.
customer_reviews.author: Sneaker411

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE this MP3
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6 year old who absolutely LOVES to bop around the house with her favorite songs. This has an external speaker that is fun to use. It connects to blue tooth and aux for private listening and blue tooth for a wireless Speaker. the interface is SUPER EASY to use. and adding music to this mP3 player is WITHOUT frustration. I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS AS ONE OF THE BEST MP3 players for A GREAT PRICE. Ive owned probably close to 7 Of these types of devices in the past few years that have cost considerably more money and nothing compares to this product. Very very Happy with this purchase.!!!
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Has some drawbacks but would probably recommend
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty cool little player. Great compact size and the bluetooth works pretty well. The interface is kind of a drag though. You have to scroll through all the songs/artists/options and it responds really slowly. Another negative is that it won't play any file that isn't an mp3 over Bluetooth, so you can't just press "shuffle all" and start jogging. Alllllso... it took a while to figure out how to add songs to the sd card. Nonetheless, it's pretty rad, given the price and storage capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Fall

customer_reviews.title: Decent value firmware upgrade could help
customer_reviews.text: The good: Seems like a solid unit, sounds good, and importing from Media Player was seamless. Haven't tried all the features yet. Economical and offers a number of features for the money. The not quite as good: The user interface isn't quite there. Got album title mixed up with artist name in one case. Not seeing the album cover photo on albums. There was a music tune already on the player (did I get a returned unit?). It does have a basic equalizer on it but the frequencies aren't shown so you have to use your logic from the controls on left to right. Will update with any changes.
customer_reviews.author: T J Thunder

customer_reviews.title: It's not bad, but not great
customer_reviews.text: I have the product, if you're someone like a jogger or doing something not super active this thing is great, I rollerblade(trick stuff), and I have found out that this thing sort of Skips and or cuts out I don't know if it's defective or not but that's how mine is. I've tried wired and wireless headphones, still cut out (slight static noise).
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Fonts too small
customer_reviews.text: There is insufficient contrast between typed words and background on this device. I cannot figure out a way to enlarge the font to make the device somewhat useful. The instruction manual is unreadable. I can't even decipher the name of the manufacturer so I can glean additional information from the web site. Not clear why Amazon thought this product was worthy of its site. I don't know to whom this device would be useful. ..................
customer_reviews.author: Fefifofum

customer_reviews.title: This Little Gem is Amazing...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use with the AUX Input in my car, and it works admirably. Music is easy to add, and albums are easy to edit. It works admirably. The only issue I have is, unfortunately a big one. The display screen is too dark to read easily in ambient light. It's easier to see indoors, however I wish it were quite a bit brighter. Or, if there is a way to make it brighter, or increase the contrast, please make it easier to find. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: DVHarris

customer_reviews.title: My husband is jealous...
customer_reviews.text: I love this mp3 player. For years my husband has tried to convince me to use an iPod. He spent hundreds to buy me one a few years ago. I hated it. I finally bought this one for myself, for a fraction of the cost. I loaded all my music on it. So easy. Tested out the ebook, video, and photo features too. At work I use the radio in the morning and listen to music and podcasts I loaded onto it. After a week, the battery hasn't even dropped one bar. This weekend while cleaning, I put it on speaker. My husband was impressed and now he wants to abandon his iPod and get one of these too. :)
customer_reviews.author: Spoon

customer_reviews.title: Great MP3 player
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 12 year old daughter to listen to music, since she is not responsible enough to use a smart phone. It seems to be working well after a month of operation. Battery is long. It was easy to drop MP3 from my surface pro to this player. Not sure on video quality as I did not use this feature. It does seem like the resolution is low, but again we only needed it for MP3. I do think a touch screen would be nice. I keep pushing the screen. I kept thinking of it like my phone screen. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Bit Dissapointing
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this would work better than the San Disk MP# players I bought for the twins because of the size and screen. However, it's not easy to navigate, won't play all of the songs that are on the San Disk players and is a pain to connect to Bluetooth. Once you get it set up, it does play music and the quality is good. I bought LETSCOM headphones to use instead of the ones that came with it which provides more comfortable and higher quality audo. The player and headphones fit fine in the hard, blue AGPTEK case I also bought.
customer_reviews.author: Conspicuous ConsumerTop Contributor: Jigsaw Puzzles

customer_reviews.title: Great little MP3 player
customer_reviews.text: This MP3 player has a lot of features. The screen is a "rotate through" type screen, not a touchscreen. It has all the categories listed on the home screen. This comes with ear buds, an arm band, instruction booklet, USB adaptor for uploading music. You can also listen to FM channels (as I do at the gym to watch NEWS or other shows while sweating bullets on the treadmill). It is nice and compact. The sound is very good and you can also listen (at the highest volume level) without ear buds, which is kind of nice when I'm working at my computer in the evening and I don't want pounding music, just something soothing.
customer_reviews.author: K. DOWNEY

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 8 weeks then died
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this back in December and started using it after Christmas. It just died (one week after I am able to return it). No display, blue light on the buttons when pressed and nothing else. Display black. So annoyed and disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JenHL1969

customer_reviews.title: Great little player
customer_reviews.text: I love the size and weight of this MP3 player. Its' just large enough that you don't think you're going to drop it. Easy to see and use interface. The only reason it doesn't get five stars is that it's tricky to download video since it takes AMV format instead of MP4. I downloaded a free converter so I am able to convert to AMV....it's just an extra step that you must go through...no big deal. After having the player for a while now, I have decided that it deserves 5 stars. NOW that I have learned how to convert the files properly it is absolutely great!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Rutledge

customer_reviews.title: Pocket sized great music player
customer_reviews.text: This is great slim pocket size mp3 music player. The material touch can helps you keep a good grip on it. It comes with earbuds & USB Charging cable cord and best part is including sport armband can easy hold when doing exercise. Built-in memory only 16GB but expand to 128GB which should enough for store all of my music. The other good feature is has FM that can let me listen my favorite radio stations. I very enjoy it and would recommend this product to friend.
customer_reviews.author: Enyuan Shih

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, UI issues with buttons, etc
customer_reviews.text: It's too heavy for sports. When in the arm pouch you can't reach the volume buttons so you have to stop, take it out of the pouch to change volume. The buttons on the front are too sensitive - I constantly by accident pause or jump forward/backward by brushing the front. Also - no lanyard loop. Sound good though.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce and Alina in Miami

customer_reviews.title: Charger Connection Already Broken
customer_reviews.text: This was a great little mp3 player, while the charger connection worked. We bought it for Christmas 2019 and here we are 4-months later with a player with no way to charge it. I am tempted to buy another one on the hope this one failing was just a one-off. I guess I would say, buy at your own risk. Ours lasted 4-months and so we paid about $10 per month to use it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Counts

customer_reviews.title: Good player with great battery life.
customer_reviews.text: It works and has a great battery life. I bought this to replace my iPod. It took a while to move my music from iTunes and had to do some reorganizing. The device is heavy for a handheld. It feels heavier than my cell phone. If you get this, use Musicbee to manage your music. Playlists built in musicbee will play on this device. If I could change one thing, it would be the display. While a song is playing, it either shows the album cover or a record playing. However, it shows a really small scroll showing the song title and artist. I’d rather the screen show the title and artist in large letters.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas M Murray

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: Overall the product is worth what I paid for it. However, the user interface is not user friendly at all, and the documentation is so worthless they might as well not have bothered. After quite a struggle, I am finally getting used to it. The problem with these devices: there are no standards one can rely on. The battery life is fair, if you want to listen to it in your car on a day's drive, it will run out of battery before you run out of gas. (I am plugging it in the AUX port, so I don't know if it will charge simultaneously if my car stereo had a USB port as well.)
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Vollbrecht

customer_reviews.title: Good product, good value
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an Mp3 player for my dad, and this met all the requirements. Bluetooth compatibility with headphones and speakers (that are also Bluetooth), a good battery life, and holds a lot of songs. After figuring out the right cord to use, transferring music was just as easy as on any other device and the instructions were very clear. It is a bit hefty, but he just uses it at his desk at work so that's fine. Solid product for the cost and is perfect for someone who isn't extremely tech savvy but likes their music!
customer_reviews.author: Terra

customer_reviews.title: It's just OK
customer_reviews.text: It plays music and sounds pretty good with the built in EQ settings. My biggest gripe is that I loaded it with couple hundred songs and would set it to shuffle but I would hear the same songs over and over. It behaved as if it created a shuffle list once and never creates a new one. Aside from that the battery life is good. The display and buttons are bright. BT connects quickly. Would I buy it again if lost? No
customer_reviews.author: SeattlePole

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT a Sansa Player
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to order and receive this player. Unlike 90% of the other players it could hold a LOT of music on a 128gB micro card. What I didn't expect is that the internal software is not powerful enough to run the system efficiently. There is a large delay in responses to button pushes and when turning on screen light. After running about 30 minutes of songs it finally catches up with power and 'next" buttons. Also the "next," "up/down," "pause/play" buttons do not light up and this is not a good thing when listening in low or no lights. It does have excellent battery life!
customer_reviews.author: John Steele

product_meta.title: MP3 Player, 16GB MP3 Player with Bluetooth 4.0, Portable HiFi Lossless Sound MP3 Music Player with FM Radio Voice Recorder E-Book 2.4'' Screen, Support up to 128GB (Headphone, Sport Armband Included)
product_meta.description:
Why Choose Soulcker MP3-Player 
♫ Built-in Speaker: You can listen your favorite music without headphone 
♫ Long Battery Life & Fast Charge: Up to 55 hours of playback with 2 hours of full charge 
♫ FM Radio: Built-in FM tuner, it supports Manual tune and Auto tune, receive the signal very easily 
♫ Large Capacity: Built-in 16GB internal memory, the mp3 player supports up to 128GB Micro TF Card, which lets you add more storage
